content:
See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-gmail#w_understanding-gmail-labels-and-thunderbird-folders

It should also state Gmail presents imap folders for the labels in your gmail account. Thunderbird thinks Gmail is just another imap server.

As for only one copy of each message, according to https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1554529#c12 this is not working.

creator: davidsk

content:
Quick Update. I think I found the reason.

The back-bouncing email had no message body, just a subject line. Apparently, Spam Filter automatically throws messages with no body back into Spam Box even after it's told not to, and even if the sender address appears in the Collected Address book..
creator: jl11

content:
That is usually a corrupt installation. My suggestion:

  1. exit thunderbird
  2. download the same or equivalent version from https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/ (that is, if you are with ESR, stay with ESR. if with monthly, stay with monthly)
  3. although not necessary, I always encourage doing a backup prior to a fresh install.
    • ensure thunderbird is not running
    • enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
    • this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
    • highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media (or a separate folder)
  4. install the downloaded new version
creator: davidsk

content: It may help if you post full error message in English, and a screenshot of the incoming server settings pane. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Thunderbird is not the aggressor here. Bitdefender intercepts email activity and is the place to correct most such issues. All thunderbird has is the privacy&security option to allow antivirus programs to quarantine messages.
creator: davidsk

content: @Rick 10GB is the total for the whole box and the emails are kept locally, in addition to IMAP servers. This is an aggregate across different email accounts. Therefore, this should not affect an import. Really, it is just a matter of importing the configurations that I am concerned about. It is a pain to spend a day to do this when I prefer not to. That is why we have 'tech', to not bother with redundant tasks.
